metadata.docDescription: The following is a list of available options that can be specified in the `rsession.conf` configuration file, which controls behavior of the `rsession` process, allowing you to tune various RStudio Pro Session parameters.

automation.description: Run RStudio as an automation agent.

automation.name: automation-report-file
automation.description: The file where automation test results should be written.

script.description: Runs an R script and exits.

verify.description: Verifies that the session installation is working correctly and exits.

version.description: Prints the version number and exits.

program.description: The program mode the session is running in (desktop or server).

log.name: log-stderr
log.description: Writes log entries to stderr in addition to any other configured log destinations.

docs.name: docs-url
docs.description: If specified, overrides the URL to navigate to when a user clicks on the RStudio help link.

www.name: www-local-path
www.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path where web assets are stored.

www.name: www-symbol-maps-path
www.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path, where symbol maps are stored.
The HTTP port to listen on for incoming connections. This is generally only used with Launcher sessions.
The address to listen on for incoming connections. This is generally only used with Launcher sessions.
Runs the session in standalone mode, indicating we should use HTTP communication. This is generally only used with Launcher sessions.
Indicates whether or not to verify signatures on incoming requests. This is generally only used with Launcher sessions.
Whether or not to reuse last used bound ports when restarting a Launcher session.

session.name: session-connections-block-suspend
session.description: Whether or not an active database connection should block attempts to suspend the session after timeout.

session.name: session-external-pointers-block-suspend
session.description: Whether or not R objects containing external pointers should block attempts to suspend the session after timeout.
The amount of minutes before a session times out, at which point the session will either suspend or exit.
Indicates whether or not to suspend the session after the timeout has elapsed. Setting this to `false` will cause the session to quit instead of suspending to disk when the session times out.
If set, causes the session to time out after not receiving any new connections within the specified minutes. This behavior is generally not needed, and you should instead use session-timeout-minutes

session.name: session-preflight-script
session.description: Sets a script to be run on startup before any R initialization has occurred.

session.name: session-create-public-folder
session.description: Indicates whether or not to create a `Public` folder for the user whenever the session starts. This folder will have global read permissions, and can be used as a simple means for users to share files. It is recommended you do not use this feature, and instead use the more advanced Project Sharing features.

session.name: session-create-profile
session.description: Indicates whether or not to create a default empty .Rprofile script within the user's home directory, which can be altered to perform any desired common startup tasks.

session.name: session-rprofile-on-resume-default
session.description: Specifies the default user setting for running the Rprofile when sessions are resumed.

session.name: session-save-action-default
session.description: Specifies the default save action (yes, no, or ask).

session.name: session-default-working-dir
session.description: Specifies the default working directory to use for new sessions.

session.name: session-default-new-project-dir
session.description: Specifies the default directory to use for new projects.

session.name: show-help-home
session.description: Indicates whether or not to show the help home page on startup.

session.name: session-default-console-term
session.description: Specifies the default TERM setting for the R console.

session.name: session-default-clicolor-force
session.description: Specifies the default CLICOLOR_FORCE setting for the R console.

session.name: session-quit-child-processes-on-exit
session.description: Indicates whether or not to quit child processes of the session on exit. If unset, child processes created by forking or parallel processing may continue to run in the background after the session is terminated.

session.name: session-first-project-template-path
session.description: Specifies the path to a first project template which will be copied into new users' home directories and opened the first time they run a session. The template can optionally be configured with `DefaultOpenDocs` to cause documents to automatically be opened for the first project.

session.name: default-rsconnect-server
session.description: Specifies the default Posit Connect server URL.
If specified, sets the port to bind the terminal server to. This should generally only be set for containerized Launcher sessions, where the port must be known.
Specifies the WebSocket keep-alive ping interval for session terminals.
Specifies the WebSocket initial connection timeout in seconds for session terminals.
Specifies the WebSocket log level for session terminals ((0=none, 1=errors, 2=activity, 3=all).
Specifies the WebSocket protocol handshake timeout for session terminals in milliseconds.
Specifies whether or not package builds output to the package project folder.

defaultValue.description: Assume the root path '/' if not defined.

session.description: The path prefix added by a proxy to the incoming RStudio URL. This setting is used so RStudio Server knows what path it is being served from. If running RStudio Server behind a path-modifying proxy, this should be changed to match the base RStudio Server URL.
Indicates whether or not to mark cookies as secure.
The value of the SameSite attribute used in cookie issued by the session.

session.name: restrict-directory-view
session.description: Indicates whether or not to restrict the directories that can be viewed within the IDE.

session.name: directory-view-allow-list
session.description: Specifies a list of directories exempt from directory view restrictions, separated by a colon character (:).

session.name: session-port-range
session.description: Constrain the range of TCP ports available to the session. Accepts a range in the form '<lower>-<upper>', e.g. 59000-59999.
Specifies a list of environment variables that will not be saved when sessions suspend, separated by a colon character (:).
Specifies whether the session should be allowed to suspend when a user has entered a partial R statement.
Enables async responses to rpc requests to prevent connection logjams in the browser, allowing interrupt of busy sessions
Duration in millis before requests are converted to async - i.e. how fast will the server free up connections when it's busy
Enables offline request handling. When the R process is busy, some requests are allowed to run
Duration in millis before requests that can be handled offline are processed by the offline handler thread.
Controls whether the session should store its metadata on the file system or send it to the server to be stored in the internal database.

session.name: session-project-user-data-dir
session.description: The folder in which RStudio should store user-specific project (.Rproj.user) data.

session.name: session-allow-project-user-data-dir-override
session.description: Whether or not users can override the default project (.Rproj.user) data directory via their own user preferences.

session.name: open-files
session.description: Files to open on session load.

allow.name: allow-vcs-executable-edit
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow editing of VCS (Version Control Systems) executables.

allow.name: allow-r-cran-repos-edit
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow editing of CRAN repositories.

allow.name: allow-vcs
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow the use of version control features.

allow.name: allow-package-installation
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow installation of packages from the packages pane.

allow.name: allow-shell
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow access to the shell dialog.

allow.name: allow-terminal-websockets
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow connections to terminal sessions with websockets.

allow.name: allow-file-downloads
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow file downloads from the files pane.

allow.name: allow-file-uploads
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow file uploads from the files pane.

allow.name: allow-remove-public-folder
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow removal of the user public folder.

allow.name: allow-rpubs-publish
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow publishing of content to external services.

allow.name: allow-external-publish
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow publishing of content to external services.

allow.name: allow-publish
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow publishing of content.

allow.name: allow-presentation-commands
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow presentation commands.

allow.name: allow-full-ui
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow full standalone UI mode.

allow.name: allow-launcher-jobs
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to allow running jobs via the Launcher.

allow.name: allow-over-limit-sessions
allow.description: Indicates whether or not to abort sessions that exceed their specified memory limit. Users will still see warnings and an error.

allow.name: abort-free-mem-percent
allow.description: Sessions will be aborted if there is less than 100 MiB of free RAM or this configured percentage. Disable abort entirely by enabling allow-over-limit-sessions. Increase this value for easily reproducing this scenario in a test environment or to more strictly enforce memory limits on the system.

r.name: r-core-source
r.description: Specifies the Core R source path.

r.name: r-modules-source
r.description: Specifies the Modules R source path.

r.name: r-session-package-archives
r.description: Specifies the R package archives path.

r.name: r-libs-user
r.description: Specifies the R user library path.

r.name: r-cran-repos-file

defaultValue.description: The first repos.conf file that is found within the XDG_CONFIG_DIRS environment, or /etc/rstudio/repos.conf if not XDG_CONFIG_DIRS are specified.

r.description: Specifies the path to a configuration file which contains default CRAN repositories.

r.name: r-cran-repos-url
r.description: Specifies the URL to a configuration file which contains optional CRAN repositories.

r.name: r-auto-reload-source
r.description: Indicates whether or not to automatically reload R source if it changes during the session.

r.name: r-compatible-graphics-engine-version
r.description: Specifies the maximum graphics engine version that this version of RStudio is compatible with.

r.name: r-resources-path
r.description: Specifies the directory containing external resources.

r.name: r-shell-escape
r.description: Indicates whether or not to support shell escape.

r.name: r-home-dir-override
r.description: Specifies the override for R_HOME (used for debug configurations).

r.name: r-doc-dir-override
r.description: Specifies the override for R_DOC_DIR (used for debug configurations).

r.name: r-restore-workspace
r.description: If set, overrides the user/project restore workspace setting. Can be 0 (No), 1 (Yes), or 2 (Default).

r.name: r-run-rprofile
r.description: If set, overrides the user/project .Rprofile run setting. Can be 0 (No), 1 (Yes), or 2 (Default).

limits.name: limit-file-upload-size-mb
limits.description: Sets a size limit in megabytes on files that are uploaded via the files pane.

limits.name: limit-cpu-time-minutes
limits.description: Sets a limit in minutes for the amount of time top level R computations may run before being interrupted.

limits.name: limit-xfs-disk-quota
limits.description: Indicates whether or not XFS quotas should be enforced when performing file operations via the files pane.

external.name: external-rpostback-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the rpostback executable.

external.name: external-consoleio-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the consoleio executable (Windows-only).

external.name: external-gnudiff-path
external.description: Specifies the path to gnudiff utilities (Windows-only).

external.name: external-gnugrep-path
external.description: Specifies the path to gnugrep utilities (Windows-only).

external.name: external-msysssh-path
external.description: Specifies the path to msys_ssh utilities (Windows-only).

external.name: external-winutils-path
external.description: Specifies the path to Hadoop Winutils (Windows-only).

external.name: external-hunspell-dictionaries-path
external.description: Specifies the path to hunspell dictionaries.

external.name: external-mathjax-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the mathjax library.

external.name: external-pandoc-path
external.description: Specifies the path to pandoc binaries.

external.name: external-quarto-path
external.description: Specifies the path to quarto binaries.

external.name: external-copilot-path
external.description: Specifies the path to Copilot Language Server binaries.

external.name: external-node-path
external.description: Specifies the path to node binaries.

external.name: external-copilot-agent-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the GitHub Copilot agent.

external.name: external-libclang-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the libclang shared library

external.name: external-libclang-headers-path
external.description: Specifies the path to the libclang builtin headers.

external.name: external-winpty-path
external.description: Specifies the path to winpty binaries.

git.name: git-commit-large-file-size
git.description: Warns when attempting to commit files larger than this size (in bytes; set 0 to disable).

defaultValue.description: The username of the session process.

user.description: The user identity for the session.
Indicates whether or not to show the user identity in the session UI.

user.name: launcher-token
user.description: Specifies the token identifying the session launcher.

copilot.name: copilot-enabled
copilot.description: Indicates whether or not GitHub Copilot integration can be enabled.

copilot.name: copilot-proxy-url
copilot.description: The proxy URL that the Copilot agent should use for outgoing network requests. Only plain HTTP proxy URLs are supported.

copilot.name: copilot-auth-provider
copilot.description: The URL to the authentication provider to be used by GitHub Copilot.

copilot.name: copilot-proxy-kerberos-service-principal
copilot.description: The Kerberos service principal to use for authenticating GitHub Copilot with the proxy.

copilot.name: copilot-ssl-certificates-file
copilot.description: The path to a file containing one or more trusted certificates in PEM format.

copilot.name: copilot-proxy-strict-ssl
copilot.description: Should the GitHub Copilot agent perform SSL certificate validation when forming web requests?

copilot.name: copilot-agent-helper
copilot.description: The path to an optional shell script, which when invoked, should start the GitHub Copilot agent.

copilot.name: copilot-helper
copilot.description: The path to an optional shell script, which when invoked, should start the GitHub Copilot Language Server.
